meanings.definition: Having a strong and unpleasant smell.
meanings.sent1: The garbage can had an olid odor that made me hold my nose.
meanings.sent2: The olid stench coming from the sewer was unbearable.
meanings.sent3: The olid smell in the room was so bad, it seemed to have its own personality.
meanings.sent4: The olid aroma hung in the air like a dark cloud of misery.
meanings.sent5: The olid scent filled the room, clinging to every surface like a noxious fog.

meanings.sent1: His olid behavior towards others made him unpopular.
meanings.sent2: The movie contained olid language that offended many viewers.
meanings.sent3: The olid joke he told was so bad, it made everyone groan.
meanings.sent4: The olid attitude of the boss made the workplace a toxic environment.
meanings.sent5: The olid taste of the medicine lingered in her mouth long after she swallowed it.
